times, AmeriCorps has been there. Disaster response, the opioid crisis, academic achievement – these are just a few areas where AmeriCorps members and AmeriCorps Seniors volunteers have made a difference in communities. Submitted by Anonymous (not verified) on Fri, 11/06/2020 - 11:26 National Service Reports Every year, AmeriCorps produces a comprehensive report about national service investments across the United States. These state reports demonstrate the scope of AmeriCorps presence throughout the nation. View the Reports Volunteering in America In partnership with the U.S. Census Bureau, AmeriCorps takes the pulse of our nation’s civic health every two years through the Current Population Survey Civic Engagement and Volunteering Supplement. View the research Evidence Reports By learning from available evidence, we can continually improve how we deliver on our mission to improve lives, strengthen communities, and foster civic engagement. The AmeriCorps Evidence Exchange is a digital repository of research, and evaluation reports. Search Evidence Exchange Learn how we build evidence of impact AmeriCorps' Open Data AmeriCorps promotes transparency by making agency data available to the public. View Our Data Watch the Open Data Introduction Video Featured Data Upon exiting service, AmeriCorps invites members to complete an exit survey to provide information on their service experiences. By collecting data on member experiences, AmeriCorps and its partners can better understand how to support members and show potential members the benefits of serving. 2022 AmeriCorps Member Exit Data Highlights from the AmeriCorps MES Dataset State of the Evidence Report In coordination with state and local entities, national service responds to the most pressing issues facing our nation. AmeriCorps members and AmeriCorps Seniors volunteers prepare today’s students for tomorrow’s jobs, reduce crime, connect returning veterans to jobs, fight the opioid epidemic, support seniors to live independently, make college more accessible and affordable, and help Americans rebuild their lives following disasters. Read the 2023 report Watch more videos about AmeriCorps' research and evaluation How We Build Evidence of Impact The agency’s strategic evidence plan provides a roadmap for generating credible, relevant, and actionable information about the extent to which it is achieving its mission. At AmeriCorps, we view evidence building as an ongoing cycle, and incorporate the process into our work across the agency through four phases: innovation, implementation, improvement, and expanded impact. AmeriCorps Learning Agenda 2022-2026 Innovation AmeriCorps researches and develops unique service programs that explore how to engage and improve communities. Implementation AmeriCorps members, grantees, and partner organizations adopt programs locally to address social issues. Improvement AmeriCorps leverages rigorous evaluation methods to measure program performance and identify opportunities for improvement. Expanded Impact Using evaluation results, AmeriCorps provides the framework for other organizations to replicate and scale programs in their communities. Supporting Research and Evaluation The AmeriCorps Office of Research and Evaluation (ORE) produces accurate and timely research on national service, social innovation, volunteering, and civic engagement. We conduct original and sponsored research and evaluations, support evaluations of grantees’ research and programs, and promote evidence-based service models – all of which infuses data into AmeriCorps programs and contributes to the public understanding of national service. Learn More About Research and Evaluation at AmeriCorps Evaluation Resources Research and Evaluation Grants AmeriCorps’ Research Grantee Activities Sign Up to Receive Research and Evaluation Updates Research and Evaluation Digest The Research and Evaluation Digest highlights the agency’s recent research, evaluation and evidence tools, reports, and knowledge building activities on national service, social innovation, volunteering, and civic engagement. The Digest is your go-to resource for original and sponsored research and evaluations, evaluations of grantees’ research and programs, and promotion of evidence-based service models – all of which infuse data into AmeriCorps programs and contribute to the public’s understanding of national service.
